meanings.sent1: I had to relist the items for sale after they expired.
meanings.sent2: She decided to relist her house on the market after taking it off briefly.
meanings.sent3: When the grocery store ran out of stock, they had to relist the items quickly.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the town had to relist all the damaged properties for assessment.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to relist the steps of the scientific method for the experiment.

meanings.definition: To place on a list again
meanings.sent1: He had to relist his name on the sign-up sheet for the event.
meanings.sent2: The librarian had to relist the returned books back into the system.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally skipped an ingredient and had to relist it on the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to relist the suspects after finding new evidence.
meanings.sent5: The secretary had to relist the appointments in the schedule after a mix-up.

meanings.definition: To add to a list again
meanings.sent1: She had to relist the missing items on the inventory sheet.
meanings.sent2: The manager had to relist the new products in the catalog.
meanings.sent3: The student forgot to relist the bonus question on the exam paper.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to relist the painting with a higher starting bid.
meanings.sent5: The editor had to relist the corrections on the final draft before printing.
